column3: let's just remove mention of a function here and call it "initialization". It may be any of the initialization-related functions that failed.
Done (also in bitcoin.cpp).\n\nFor my information: how should I address feedback: with new commits for easier review, or with amending? I amended this time.
For documentation/string commits like this, amending is best IMO.\nFor more involved commits, it can make sense to keep a history, at least until merge.
This is no longer true, by the way. Since #9010, the -daemon handling is in bitcoind.cpp, not in init.cpp.
Thanks. The comment seems to not be true anyway, so I removed it altogether.
